Subjective: Muscle tension; rapid heartbeat; heart palpitations; shortness of breath; fatigue; sleep problems; worrying and fretting about work. Unable to relax due to work-related stress. Difficulty falling asleep due to thoughts about work. Works as a doctor in internal medicine; recently graduated; lives with housemates who are also doctors; has a support system of friends and colleagues who understand work-related stress. Request: Rule out somatic causes for symptoms; discuss stress and work-related issues with a professional.
Objective: BP 120/60; HR 65/min; oxygen level 98%; breathing rate 14/min. Normal heart sounds; no murmurs. No abdominal complaints.
Assessment: Stress-related symptoms; possible burnout. No somatic causes identified on physical examination.
Plan: Conduct blood test to rule out anaemia and other somatic causes.
Refer to mental health nurse for stress management and work-related issues.
Recommend regular relaxation techniques, such as taking breaks and engaging in activities that give energy.
Suggest contacting occupational health and safety service for support with work schedule and contract.
Follow-up appointment if symptoms worsen or concerns arise.
